posts.name: Sdsdsasad12312
posts.cooked: Add a feature that lets users favorite messages and save them into a list that they can check later on. It’s fundamental when you wanna find special moments /memories / pictures and stuff.

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat
Add message-specific properties for granular control over individual messages
Pin a message to top of chat
A forum category is a mediocre way to track feature requests
Pin a message to top of chat

posts.cooked:
Can you explain more, what you are suggesting? There are some feature-requests already which are similar, but not identical, to what it sounds like you are asking about.

pinned-welcome-msg, pinned-perma-msg, reaction-emoji, annotation-tagging

There is a feature-request to allow a message to be ‘pinned’ (sometimes called stickied), which is mostly applicable to groupchats. When a message is pinned-welcome, it automatically appears at the top of the (blank) chat-history whenever a new member is added to the groupchat. Very different: when a message is pinned-permanently, it automatically appears at the bottom of the chat-history at all times, for all groupchat members, where it basically hovers over the send-message-textarea (or over the quoted-reply-preview-area when than is visible). The pinned-welcome message is usually something like “welcome to Xyz Corp groupchat and here is the purpose and if you have any questions or problems here are the people you can contact”… it can be quite long, and might span multiple 2000-byte chat-bubbles. The pinned-permanently message by contrast is typically quite short, usually just a sentence-fragment or two: “No leaks. Be courteous. Cf our groupchat-rules.”

There is a different kind of feature-request, which is applicable to groupchats but also applicable to 1-on-1 chats, where message-bubbles can have reaction-emoji. Here in signalUsers there is a limited version of that: by clicking on the little thing at the bottom of a particular forum-post, you can award a ‘heart’ aka “loved it” kind of emoji-reaction to the author of the posting. If multiple forum-participants award hearts, the heart-count for that forum-post goes upwards. Over on Signal · GitHub there are more options: you can heart a github-comment, but you can also +1 and rocketShip and smiley and a half-dozen other things.

This is basically a form of controlled-vocabulary tagging-system, but with emoji rather than textual-tags (such as would be common in a blogging-platform for instance). If the reaction-emoji were implemented within signalapp, I can imagine that people would want to be able to search for chat-bubbles that were “tagged” with specific emoji, either by anybody, or by specific people. So it would be possible, in your 1-on-1 chats and in your groupchats, to utilize your reaction-emoji as a kind of favoriting-specific-posts. However… the main downside here is that reaction-emoji (or reaction-textual-tags) are going to be public by design. If you are in a 1-on-1 chat and you put a heart-shaped reaction-emoji onto a message, both you and your chat-partner will see that heart-icon. If you are in a 99-member groupchat and 37 people put +1 reaction-emoji on chinese food whereas 52 put +1 reaction-emoji on italian food, you are having pizza for lunch and everybody knows it.

The feature-request that you seem to be describing, is a means of organizing materials for your own use, later on. If your boss sends your team-groupchat a series of long-term goals, you might want to put on a reaction-emoji that you know the boss will see (heart +1 +1 heart heart thinkingFace +1 etc). But simultaneously, you might also want to add your own annotations, which are visible only to you and not to the rest of your team-groupchat (costly infeasible doomed ignoreThis delegateThis doomed impossible wtf doomed etc). Here you are engaging in a kind of locally-available subject-tagging and prioritization, useful later on for searching/grouping/triage efforts as you try to work through the task-list. Similar feature would be useful in a friends&family context: you would give Auntie Alice some polite reaction-emoji for her vacation-photos, but you would add your own local annotations which described how you would really search for them later on (goofyExpressions unintentionallyHilarious defineIrony etc).

I think it would be possible to have both reaction-emoji, as well as annotation-texts, tied to each message-bubble in a chat, at the enduser’s discretion. Reaction-emoji could be added by longpress > reaction > heart > ok, whereas annotations could be added by longpress > annotate > typing-some-text > ok … but I think these can be combined more easily into a single high-speed UX. Double-tap on a message-bubble, and above the msg-bubble you should immediately see a small tray of reaction-emoji (not the fullsize emoji-picker which has hundreds), while simultaneously below the message-bubble a small annotation-textbox should appear (with the vkeyboard already opened and ready to annotate).

This UI-approach makes reacting a cinch: you notice a message that needs a response, double-tap it, heart it, and you are done – total of two-and-a-half quick taps to react. This is considerably faster than longpress > reaction > heart > okBtn which takes four-and-a-half taps with considerable distance of finger-travel needed. Annotations with more nuance than the constrained vocab of the reaction-emoji-mini-picker, can be arbitrarily complicated, but short ones take just a few speedy taps to create. Later, when doing full-text-search, you can find all the chat-messages that you heart’d with a reaction-emoji, and also find all the chat-messages that you annotated with Feb2019 textual-tags, equally easily.

link_counts.title: Contacts refuse to use Signal because it lacks many things
Show custom message to new members of a group chat

posts.name: rocknjohn
posts.cooked:
He’s talking about long pressing on a message and clicking “favorite”, to mark a message as a favorite. Then in the future, if you click on the contact’s name, click “View favorite messages” and a thread-like view of just the starred messages in that conversation is visible. It makes it easy to quickly reference the important messages with a contact.

I agree it’s a nice to have feature, but not super high priority.

posts.name: Zeh
posts.cooked: It is a very nice feature to have because sometimes when you have a very long conversation it makes life much easier to look only for those messages marked as favorite.

sdsdsasad12312:

lets users favorite messages and save them into a list that they can check later on

There is actually kinda-sorta something like this now. You cannot really favorite a specific message (tag/annotate it for later).

But as a workaround, you CAN longpress a message to select it, and then forward it to the notes-to-self conversation. Then check it later on, if you want to reminisce.

However, due to restrictions of message forwarding, this workaround has some draw-backs. For example, if you forward a message including a quote, you’ll lose the link to the quoted message (actually the whole quote chain), hence losing context.

link_counts.title: Retain response context when messages are forwarded

posts.cooked:
PiCob:

you’ll lose the link to the quoted message (actually the whole quote chain)

Excellent point, thank you. See my deeplink via sgnl://bazquux feature-request ;-)

link_counts.title: When tapping phone number: "Open with Signal call"

posts.name: Leonard
posts.cooked: I too would love to have starred/favourite messages.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
I propose not to call it “favorite messages” and also not “favorites” but instead call it exactly what it is: “bookmarked messages” and “bookmarks”. That will make it a bit easier to relate the function to what it was meant to be used for.

@leonard please just use the “heart” symbol to “like” a post if all you want ot add is a vote in favor, we do this to prevent a whole lot of “me too” posts.

posts.name: Leonard
posts.cooked:
My wife and I share a lot of information on Signal and whilst a lot of it is just idle chit chat, every now again I would like to mark a message so that I can find it again easily at a later time.

Other apps have the concept of starred messages and a allow you to see them in a special list view.

I request that something like that to be added to Signal.

What do people think about this?

leonard:

concept of starred messages

I would rather have reactionEmoji with justForMe. Here is the starred-messages feature-request, in a groupchat with Alice + Bob + Chuck + Dave.

  • Alice:  sznoo!
  • Bob:   uh… what’s sznoo?
  • Alice:  not much, what’s new with you? hee hee ;-)

If Chuck thinks this is mildly amusing, he has to decide… is it worth starring that message, to review this great moment in comedy? Dave on the other hand is hysterically laughing and wishes he could give the message 9000 stars it is so funny. But nobody else in the groupchat is able to tell, whether Dave liked the message, because only Dave can see the messages that he starred, on his own devices. As far as Alice can tell, her attempt at making a joke fell flat.

Now, if we repeat the same scenario, same 3 messages as before, same groupchat of 4 people, but with reactionEmoji and the justForMe checkbox, we have the following situation: Bob can send the reactionEmoji and leave the justForMe checkbox off (which is the default), since he thinks that is a pretty crazy joke. Chuck has mixed emotions, but he is no longer constrained to like-or-abstain, he can give some nuance: he sends as a combination, but he does NOT then additionally need to tag the chat-bubble with and JustForMe, which is Chuck’s usual way to emoji-categorize stuff he finds really funny to look back on later. Dave meanwhile, immediately sends reactionEmoji …and the longer he considers how awesome Alice’s humour was the more reactionEmoji he adds, to express his true feelings. After checking JustForMe first, Dave also marks the emoji on Alice’s joke, reminding himself that this one was so funny it left him in stitches and in need of a doctor. Alice can also, if she wishes, react to the reactions, and leave her own reactionEmoji on her own message, to commemorate this moment in comedic history.

The downside to reactionEmoji is that it takes two taps to react: one to open the reactionEmoji popup, and then a 2nd tap to select a recently-used reactionEmoji. With the starred-messages thing, only one tap is needed: you just tap the star, and you are done. Searching is less powerful though, because everything is either star-or-not and there is no way to do combos; reactionEmoji permit combos, can optionally offer JustForMe checkbox in the reactionEmoji-popup to prevent others from seeing the reaction in question, and can even permit a series of sequential reaction-back-n-forth

Ideally though, I think it should be possible to react with an arbitrary set of text to a particular post: thataway, instead of just one or more reactionEmoji, we give the groupchat members the power of arbitrary unicode tagging. Dave can react with :-) or he can react with “ha!” or he can do something longer and more complex. Tagging with keywords like “todo” is helpful, but Alice can also tag with “7/4/19” if she is working on a shopping-list for a holiday celebration. So my first choice would be text-tagging, my second choice would be reactionEmoji with optional justForMe, and starred-messages would be okay-but-a-bit-limited.

I wanted to resurrect this old thread, since we are hunting feature requests. This I think will be another one of those nice to have things, that can change the experience with the app:

As summarised above by OP, the ability to mark a message (or more) inside a conversation, as favourite. Or to bookmark that message. And then, maybe somewhere inside the conversation option, to have this option:

Favourite Messages - and I can see all the bookmarked/fav messages with that contact.

This can also be very useful inside groups, to bookmark important messages to come back to later, when usually large conversation tend to loose important things in the noise.

Hello all.
The feature is well explained here : "Starred Message" Feature In Signal Private Messenger — Steemit

This could be implemented by creating another “Note to Self” named “Starred Messages”. This would be a very useful feature.

We have many groups, example : COVID-19 Awareness group. I find many posts very interesting and useful. I want to star them for myself so that I can view them later. Otherwise, they would be buried under lot of other messages.

Thanks.

link_counts.title: "Starred Message" Feature In Signal Private Messenger — Steemit

posts.cooked: Just forward that messages to Note to Self.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
I am personally not a fan of bringing a copy of bookmarked messages all to the same conversation. They just don’t have anything to do with each other, each message belongs only in the context of the convrsation in which you received or send it.

As an alternative to easily finding your bookmarked messages by bringing them all together, I propose to add a quick scroll button to jump directly to the next or the previous starred message. It works very similar to searching a message with a certain word in it. The search function allows you to jump from one mesage to the next, and shows you a counter of the total number of available messages eith that word. The only difference would be that you are not searching a word, but you are searching a bookmarked message.

You should still be able to search only within your bookmarked messages, so the search feature should be able to filter on “search within bookmarks only”.

How about implementing it exactly as it’s in Whatsapp? Means each contact and group should have its own list of starred messages which can be viewed just like we view list of shared media. And while global searching also search for term in all starred messages list.

link_counts.title: WhatsApp FAQ - How to star or unstar a message

posts.cooked: Any news about this one? I was thinking exactly the same, Whatsapp and Telegram has this feature but I want to use Signal. So…?

I’m also looking for something like this.
Here’s my use case:

Oftentimes I read a message but don’t have time to react on it immediately. This is when I’d like to save that message. Later, when I have time, I can look at the list of saved messages, do what I have to do (reply, …) and remove the message from that list.

In other words, to me this would be more of a “save for later”/reminder feature but I really don’t care if you call this starred messages, saved messages, bookmarks, favorites, …

The functionality I’d like to see is the following:

  • 1 central list which shows all such saved messages
  • Clicking on a message in that list should bring me to the original message. This is important since the saved message may only be the beginning of a conversation where important info follows and I don’t want to have to save every message belonging to “1 context/topic” but only need the “entry point”.

So what I’m looking for is basically the same behavior WhatsApp offers with its “Starred messages” feature.

Thanks & best regards!

posts.name: Navneet Vikram Tey
posts.cooked:
I would like to have this feature too, since it helps you to look through important stuff that you probably have said to someone like (bank account number of people, I used to do that a lot on whats-app). I would also like it to work with my proposed design of trimmed convo. on here Customized Trimmed Conversation

Customized Trimmed Conversation

What am I proposing?

  1. A global trimming option in setting.
  2. A custom trimming option for every group

Both trimming option support some basic option like

“Trim before x messages”
“Exclude media types (video|audio|photos)”
“Include those excluded media if >x size”

and like notifications, custom settings overrides global ones.

Why setting disappearing message doesn’t work.
It clears everything , all messages , this is counter-intuitive to what am proposing

If a message is marked Favorite it won’t be trimmed or removed from your devices , provided it’s not a disappearing message.

posts.name: Navneet Vikram Tey
posts.cooked:
I have thought of UI experience with Bookmark.
There can be 2 types of messages

  1. Disappearing messages
  2. Normal messages

For disappearing message when you bookmark it , you create copy of that message and save it to database.
For normal message when you bookmark it , you create a link towards the original message.

UI elements
“Bookmarks” to be accessible from MainView using three dot menu on top right

Bookmarks should be shown in order of most recent first, and you can filtered it by conversations.

When you open any conversation, you can use 3 dot menu , you can access bookmark from there, this will open the bookmarks entries , which is already filtered with current conversation.
